content:
Please read this article to get rid of that Password prompt: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

Only follow the Change your Primary Password and Remove your Primary Password sections. Do not follow any instructions from the "Reset your Primary Password" section. That will delete all your emails.

After reading the article to locate the area to change the Primary Password, only type your password in the "Current password" box. Then leave the two boxes underneath that empty. Then click the OK button at the bottom. The password should now be gone.

Screenshot:

Per la visualizzazione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale

content:
I don't know what you need, but this may help: - the profile default location is c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profilename> - within the profile the mail is normally in the imapmail folder for IMAP accounts and the Mail folder for POP accounts - within the relative imapmail or mail folder, the structure is <accountname>\<message folders> - message folders have two components, the message folder itself, and an index file ending in .msf - example would be inbox, inbox.msf, sent, sent.msf, etc.

To view your specific setup,

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  3. you are now in the profile and the imapmail and mail folder are now visible.
creator: davidsk

content: I need to extract user@example.com from the user profile folder. So my question is, HOW CAN I DO THIS? Here's an example of what I did after I remotely connected to the compueter: $str=type .\inbox|?{$_ -match "^to"}|select -first 1; if ($str.StartsWith('To: =?UTF-8?')){$name1=$str.split().split("@")[2];$name1=$name1.TrimStart('<'); $name1} else{ $name=$str.split().split("@")[1]; $name} $name will display user in this case, but when connecting to another computer, the account will be in a different place and $name will no longer display mail.

content:
First, did you click the link in the error message to get more information on the error? That may help. Your message is being rejected by the recipient's email host. Does this happen for all recipients? This could be that your message is viewed as spam, or otherwise difficult to verify, or that the recipient's email address is incorrect. You can locate SMTP server by these steps:

  1. click 'account settings'
  2. highlight account name and click to display account info. at bottom of pane is link to SMTP server. click 'Edit SMTP server' and do screenshot of the pane that pops up,

content:
This is the link I was referring to: 

 https://csi.cloudmark.com/en/reset?ip=181.215.176.54    if only one recipient is refusing, it might be a suspected spam, but if it is several, it may be that your sending domain isn't being verified. I cannot resolve this, but only offer suggestions. It appears that your site is hosted by justhost,com, and that could also be an issue. That is, when you send mail, the receiving host sees that the sending email domain,  thehappyrich.club, as supposedly hosted by justhost.com. It then may check justhost to verify that. If this is a new domain, I suggest you send to more than a few recipients to get more infomation on the issue.

content:
Hang on a minute... you mention hotmail and that opens a can of worms if you have not recently sorted out all the latest Microsoft alterations.

You may already be using correct profile otherwise you would not be seeing anything if a new profile had been created. You say : My profile from yesterday is gone Are we talking about the same thing....a 'profile name' folder contains all preferences and address books. mail accounts etc etc etc. All profiles get listed in the 'about:profiles' as mentioned by david. profiles are not mail accounts.

Please provide the following info:

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all the data and post it into this forum question.

This will tell the forum whether you are using a Pop or Imap account and whether you have already altered both incoming and smtp as follows Authentication Method: Oauth2

I need you to check the following because Microsoft now say - the password you use to logon to MS or outlook.com account must be the same and that includes all other such as hotmail.com, live.com, msn.com So please logon to MS account and any other ones - please make sure all passwords are the same.

Microsoft now say whilst you can have several incoming email addresses, if you want to send email via SMTP then you can only send using whatever is set as 'primary'. But you can choose what you want as 'primary'.

that means if eg: email@outlook.com is set as primary then in Thunderbird your email@hotmail.com mail account must use SMTP setting username = email@outlook.com otherwise MS will not allow sending.

Logon to MS account - I think it's under...Manage how you sign in Make a note of what email address is set up as 'primary'.

Confirm you have got all passwords the same and you know what email address is set up as 'primary'.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Then you need to look at your current profile name folder to see what it contains.

  • Help > TRoubleshooting Information
  • Under 'Application Basics' - half way is 'Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder.

You should see tow folder 'Mail' and 'ImapMail'

  • If you used POP accounts - click on 'Mail' folder
  • Post image showing contents of 'Mail' folder
  • If you see pop mail acount name folder - click on it to see contents
  • Make sure you are seeing all details in columns - Name, Size, Type, Modified Date
  • Post images showing all contents.
  • If you used 'IMAP accounts' click on click on 'ImapMail' folder
  • Post image showing contents of 'ImapMail' folder
  • If you see imap mail acount name folder - click on it to see contents
  • Make sure you are seeing all details in columns - Name, Size, Type, Modified Date
  • Post images showing all contents.

Please make sure those images also include the direcory data so we can be certain what the profile name folder is called.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thanks for providing your current settings, but they are not used any more.

For a rochester.rr account Spectrum state you must use the following: https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings

In 'Account Settings' Edit the 'Server Settings' to use the following:

  • Server name: mail.twc.com
  • Port: 993 (used for imap accounts)
  • User name = your full email address
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password

Edit the SMTP so it says:

  • Description: dcady rochchester.rr (means it's easier to check correct smtp is selected)
  • Server Name: mail.twc.com
  • Port: 587
  • User name: full email address
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Connection SEcurity: STARTTLS

Then Exit Thunderbird, wait a few moments for background processes to complete and then restart Thunderbird.

content:
What is this?

It's an OAuth authentication token. With OAuth2 authentication Thunderbird only remembers a token, and not the actual account password. So any IMAP or SMTP password for that account can be deleted in Thunderbird password manager.

content: Your error indicates that gmail is rejecting you. There are many possibilities, but my first guess is validation of domain. you have a personal domain and there is the possibility that the email host may not have DKIM and SPF security settings in place. Or maybe gmail sees your email as spam. Hard to know. A web search for AUP#CDRBL will open many websites with suggestions. You are receiving a generic error code of 550, which has several possibilities, none of which are related to Thunderbird.

content: here are my thoughts: - delete all contacts in addressbook - manually create one or two valid accounts - export a csv from thunderbird, this gives you a template so that you know how thunderbird wants csv organized. - if you have a spreadsheet program, that is easiest way to view the layout. remember, the top row usually as names of the columns - now, load your csv into the spreadsheet and modify as necessary to mirror the thunderbird layout, keeping the same top row - now, save the updated csv and import that, and then view the addressbook to verify contents

content:
Hard to tell whether that worked. For some reason later (an hour or two after the original email came), another email from the same sender with the same timestamp (i.e. an hour or two earlier) appeared in my inbox, this time with the correct text. I deleted (trashed) the spurious one and filed the correct one. After receiving your reply, I found the spurious email in my Trash folder, and tried your suggestion on that folder. Now the spurious text shows up in an email with timestamp just now (i.e. the time I rebuilt the index, not the time of the original email), but without any sender or subject line; and there is no email in my trash with the sender/ subject line. So maybe your solution would have worked, had I not banished the spurious one to the trash folder.

I'll keep your reply in mind in case this ever happens again. Thank you!
creator: mcswell

content: Is your account set up via IMAP? Make sure the sent folder in TB is mapped to the correct sent folder on the server

content:
Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

And reducing the size of your Inbox would be a good idea too.

creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, I would enjoy a free bottle of George Dickel, but we're a free resource. :).. We do this because we like to assist. What you're experiencing sounds like a technical interruption. When you have multiple sent folders, that is indicative of 'something' preventing Thunderbird from saving files at shutdown. antivirus? firewall? other stuff? I don't know, but something is interfering. If you have a proprietary antivirus, my first suggestion is to see if there is a setting to ignore email. if no such setting exists, I suggest temporarily shutting the antivirus down. check your profile for further issues, such as multiple prefs.js files.
creator: davidsk

content: I respect you are having problems, but we have had tens of thousands of updates and this has not been reported.
